item.title: The best foreign language for science? 6 reasons why (anglophone) researchers should learn German
item.author: Author
item.description: English is the indesputable lingua-franca of science. Scientific work is published in English, conferences are conducted in English, and scientific courses of study at universities around the world are often at least partially taught in English. There’s no getting around English in science.

item.title: Visiting my boyfriend is not tourism
item.author: Author
item.description: As pandemic lockdown measures ease and borders begin to slowly reopen, rarely do policymakers seem to recognize any distinction between seeing loved ones and seeing sights. Those hoping to reunite with anyone who isn’t their spouse or minor child will likely need to wait for tourism from their country to be given the green light.
